page.title: 14FARMING IN BRORA 2
page.content: THE SEEDS OF CORN ARE CUT OFF THE STALKS AND CRUSHED. OATS AND BARLEY SEEDS ARE FED TO ANIMALS. FARMS ARE VERY IMPORTANT TO FARMERS BECAUSE IT IS THEIR LIVING.MOST FARMS ARE VERY EXPENSIVE TO BUY BECAUSE OF ALL THE LAND WHICH IS INVOLVED.A LOT OF BOYS THAT HAVE LEFT SCHOOL AND ARE ON THE DOLE GET EMPLOYED ON FARMS. IN THE SUMMER TIME YOU GET SOME SALES IN BRORA. THEY ARE HELD UP NEAR CLYNE.THERE ARE SHEEP SALES AND CATTLE SALES. IF ALL THE ANIMALS ARE NOT BOUGHT, THEY GET SOLD TO THE SLAUGHTER HOUSE . MOST OF THE FARMS ARE RUN BY MACHINERY.IT SAVES THE FARMER AND THE HORSE FROM HARD WORK.THE MOST COMMON MACHINES USED ARE : BALERS, COMBINE HARVESTERS, TRACTORS AND TRAILORS, PLOUGHS AND CUTTERS.
